intro: Phoebe poeppigii, commonly known as the Hawaiian phoebe, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Phoebe poeppigii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native wildlife species.
